verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
Such love, such wondrous love,
Such love, such wondrous love,

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
That God should love a sinner such as I,
How wonderful is love like this!

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
That God should love
a sinner such as I,
Should yearn to change
my sorrow into bliss,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
Nor rest till He had planned
to bring me nigh,
How wonderful is love like this!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
That Christ should join
so freely in the scheme,
Although it meant
His death on Calvary,
Did ever human tongue
find nobler theme
Than love divine
that ransomed me?

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
That for a wilful outcast
such as I,
The Father planned,
the Savior bled and died;

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
Redemption for a worthless
slave to buy,
Who long had law
and grace defied.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
And now He takes me
to His heart - a son,

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
He asks me not to
fill a servant’s place;
The “Far-off country”
wand’rings all are done,
Wide open are His arms of grace.
